cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 235 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the eastern Gulf, forecast to turn north and make landfall in the western Florida Panhandle, then weaken while tracking inland across Alabama-Georgia toward the southern Appalachians
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Florida Panhandle (near Panama City â€“ Pensacola corridor)
cyclone._comment: Storm core is forecast to remain inland and never move offshore near the New York Bight
cyclone._comment2: No strike expected in the New York, NY & NJ area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge and tropical-storm watches confined to Florida Panhandle and Big Bend coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm-surge warning Indian Pass FL to Yankeetown FL; Tropical-storm warning Navarre FL to Wakulla/Jefferson Co. line
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Alabama eastward through the Florida Big Bend; inland Alabama-Georgia-Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at New York, NY & NJ
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture may bring showers mid-week, but heavy tropical rainfall (4 in+) is not anticipated
